title: News page: remove date autofill, clarify date format, and add PIN-gated Options panel with Remove News workflow

requirements.text: Remove the date autofill control from the News entry form so users can no longer auto-populate month/day/year with today's date.

quotes: can your remove the autofill date option

acceptanceCriteria: In the "Fill in your Newspaper" dialog, there is no calendar/autofill button/icon next to the Month/Day/Year inputs.
No code path remains that sets the date fields automatically (e.g., remove/stop using the autofill handler).

requirements.text: Add clear helper text near the date inputs on the News entry form to distinguish Month, Day, and Year (English user-facing text).

quotes: also add like a text that can help us distinguise month day and year.

acceptanceCriteria: A visible helper line is shown in the Date section clarifying the expected format (e.g., "Format: MM / DD / YYYY").
The helper text is located adjacent to the Month/Day/Year inputs so it is seen while filling the date.

requirements.text: After the user enters the correct PIN, show an Options UI (titled "Option") that provides two selectable choices: "Add News" and "Remove News", instead of immediately opening the Add News form.

quotes: Also when you enter the pin add a box titled Option with two boxes add news and remove news

acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the correct PIN closes the PIN dialog and opens an Options view titled exactly "Option".
The Options view contains two clearly separated selectable controls labeled exactly "Add News" and "Remove News".
Selecting "Add News" opens the existing add-news form dialog.
Selecting "Remove News" opens the remove-news UI described in REQ-4.

requirements.text: Implement a Remove News flow: when "Remove News" is selected, show a section titled "Remove a Newspaper" with a control to choose which existing news item (text/article) to remove, and a submit action that removes it from the backend and updates the list.

quotes: when you click remove news a new box will appear titled Remove a Newspaper and there will be a box letting you choose which text to remove and later you are able to submit to remove the news.

acceptanceCriteria: The UI displays a visible section (or dialog) titled exactly "Remove a Newspaper".
The remove UI provides a selector (e.g., dropdown/list) populated with existing news items so the user can choose one to remove.
A submit button triggers a removal request; on success, the removed item no longer appears in the Latest News list without a page refresh.
If removal fails, an English error message is shown and the item remains in the list.

requirements.text: Add backend support for deleting a news item and expose it to the frontend via a new React Query mutation hook used by the Remove News flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes a new update method to remove a specific news item deterministically (using an unambiguous identifier such as the news timestamp).
Frontend includes a new hook (similar to existing publish hook) to call the backend removal method and invalidates/refetches the ['news'] query on success.
Remove operations do not break existing publish/getAllNews behavior and newest-first ordering remains intact.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose existing UI components instead.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication methods (Internet Identity-only; PIN gating remains client-side as currently implemented).
Do not introduce external databases or third-party APIs.
Do not change the public News page layout beyond what is necessary to support the new Options and Remove News flows.
